records.context_note: Walking on the street in Mytilini, on 18.06.2020 afternoon, the expert twisted the ankle in a small hole. She had an appointment immediately with the doctor and the doctor prescribed crutches for 4 days. It is just a little injury and normally she could walk normally on Monday, 22.06. She will have another appointment on Monday afternoon just to make a second medical check.
records.evidence_quote: Walking on the street in Mytilini, on 18.06.2020 afternoon, the expert twisted the ankle in a small hole.

records.context_note: Today (21.5.2020) text removed - justification 2 had a patrol between Text removed- justification 5. When the text removed - justification 2 arrived at their patrolling area Text removed - justification 4 Text removed - justification 5) they saw a TCG Text Removed - Justification 2 driving around of a Greek fishing vessel (AGIA PARASKEVI). The fishing vessel was just in the borderline of GTW and TTW. The TCG Text Removed - Justification 2 detected the text removed - justification 2 and start driving around the text removed - justification 2 also. Text removed - justification 2 try to get contact to TCG Text Removed - Justification 2 with text removed - justification 6 with negative results. Text removed - justification 2 tried also signal the TCG Text Removed - Justification 2 with hand signals to come closer so they could ask that what is going on, but also with negative results. When the TCG Text Removed - Justification 2 detected that their actions had no effect to the text removed - justification 2 they stopped their aggressive driving. The hole incident took approximately two hours and TCG Text Removed - Justification 2 went back to Turkish coast.

records.location_details: Molyvos, Lesvos, Greece. Reference to the operational area: Yes.
records.context_note: An accident happened on 10 May in the afternoon on board of text removed - justification 2 deployed to Molivos - Lesvos - involving text removed - justification 2. During maintenance activity of the vessel the officer fell down and injured his leg. At the beginning it didn't appear as a serious accident. The day after (on 11 May) text removed - justification 2 was examined at Kalloni Medical Centre and the result of X-Ray was Tibia fissure. The officer was medicated accordingly and requested to rest until the end of deployment. (18/05/2020) Text removed - justification 2 was informed today. (12/05/2020).
records.evidence_quote: During maintenance activity of the vessel the officer fell down and injured his leg.

records.context_note: During the night fires broke out in the offices of the Asylum Service, as well as in the canteen of RIC VIAL. Two cars were also set on fire, while the refugees were engaged in a stone fight with HP. It is speculated that the incidents started due to the death of a 49-year-old IRQ woman, who was transported dead to the hospital of Chios on Saturday afternoon. The woman lamented about fever and other typical incidents of a flu for some days. Nevertheless a performed COVID 19 test was negative. The fires could be stopped by the fire brigade. According to information from HP the whole situation calmed down. The riots actually broke out as reaction of the death of a 47 year old IRN woman. Moreover several tents and containers outside the main building, but also inside the main building, where all the organisations and agencies are located, were damaged and destroyed. One of the burnt down vehicles was a police car, LPC stated. In addition to that, text removed - justification 2 nightshift cleared up the situation on site and were able to find out that, regarding to the damages inside RIC Vial, also text removed - justification 6 are concerned. Obviously there are basically glass harms and damages of the text removed - justification 6 outer walls, etc. no completely destruction, as well as no vandalism inside the text removed - justification 6 concerning more FX assets.
records.evidence_quote: During the night fires broke out in the offices of the Asylum Service, as well as in the canteen of RIC VIAL.
